channel.title: Stranger Foods
channel.description: A catalogue of recipes Tom has made.

item.title: Spiced lamb & apricot stew
item.description:
Spiced lamb & apricot stew



Persian stews can be made with absolutely any combination of meat or poultry married with any vegetable, or even fruit. Combining meat and fruit is a very Persian thing and this influence has most famously extended to both Indian and North African cuisines.

item.title: Moroccan mushrooms with couscous
item.description:
Moroccan mushrooms with couscous



This filling Moroccan meal is packed full of vitamins and vegetables

item.title: Saffron chicken kababs with peaches
item.description:
Saffron chicken kababs with peaches



Also known as Joojeh Kabab ba Holu, an Iranian barbecue would be incomplete without the dizzying scent of saffron chicken kababs on the grill.

item.title: Persian dried lime, lamb & split pea stew
item.description:
Persian dried lime, lamb & split pea stew



Known as khoresh-e-gheymeh, this is one of the most popular stews of Iran and the great news is that it is one of the most simple to make.

item.title: Sweet and salty lentil spaghetti
item.description:
Sweet and salty lentil spaghetti



This sauce is inspired by the Sicilian dish caponata, but with the salty and sour elements stirred in at the end. When cooking lentils, don't add acidity and salt too early as it can prevent them from becoming tender - good to remember if you're substituting them for meat or veg in your favourite recipes
